a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x powr (2/3) = 7"
shows  "x = 49"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of $x$ which satisfies $\sqrt[3]{x\sqrt{x}}=7$? The final Answer is 49
 ### Proof
 $$x\sqrt{x}=x^{3/2}$$ $$\sqrt[3]{x^{3/2}}=x^{1/2}$$ So $$\sqrt{x}=7\Rightarrow x=\boxed{49}$$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x powr (2/3) = 7"
shows  "x = 49"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the value of $x$ such that $x^{2/3} = 7$. The final answer is $49$.

a_1.formal problem:

assumes h0 : "x * sqrt x powr (1/3) = 7"
shows  "x = 49"

 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x * sqrt x powr (1/3) = 7"
shows  "x = 49"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the value of $x$ such that $x\sqrt[3]{\sqrt{x}} = 7$. The final answer is $x = 49$.
